Description: Solid-cast copper alloy seated figure of Harpocrates with the side-lock and headcap and uraeus; amulet on cord around neck, two ties shown behind neck; inlaid eyes in unidentified white material (electrum ?) with black pupil; right hand to the mouth; square plinth with hieroglyphic inscription invoking Harpocrates; modern rod inserted at the base of the spine.
Excavator/field collector: Field Collection by: Dr Joseph John Acworth
Exhibition history: Exhibited: 2006-present, Glasgow, Kelvingrove Art Gallery and Museum, LT Loan Ancient Egypt British Museum Partnership Gallery
Acquisition name: Donated by: Mrs Marion Whiteford Acworth JP
